alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris; Somerset; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 05 at 3:08AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...AN AREA OF LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT MORRIS...HUNTERDON...SUSSEX...WARREN... NORTHWESTERN SOMERSET...EAST CENTRAL BERKS...SOUTHEASTERN LEHIGH... NORTHERN MONTGOMERY...NORTHWESTERN BUCKS AND SOUTHEASTERN NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 306 AM EST, an area of light snow showers was located along a line extending from Pellettown to Roxburg to Bechtelsville. Movement was east at 35 mph. Wind gusts up to 40 mph are possible with these snow showers. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Easton, Morristown, Newton, Bethlehem, Dover, Lansdale, Hopatcong, Forks, Emmaus, Kinnelon, Hackettstown, Quakertown, Perkasie, Doylestown, Byram, Boonton, Wilson, Butler and Souderton. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 26 and 52. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 59 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 31. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 8 and 45. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 21 and 26, between mile markers 28 and 33, and between mile markers 36 and 54. Icy roads are possible as the snow melts on the roads then quickly refreezes. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
